FacilityName: Associated Wholesale Grocers, Inc. Fort Worth DC

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Associated Wholesale Grocers Inc. is a national retailer of grocery products, with stores across the United States. Associated Wholesale Grocers inc. supplies retail grocery stores throughout Texas and the southwest region through it's Fort Worth Distribution Center located at 7550 Oak Grove Road, Fort Worth, TX, 76140. The Fort Worth distribution center employs approximately 600. The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, 52 weeks per year. The highest Occupancy occurs Monday-Friday from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

The system described in this submittal is the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration  system utilized in the warehousing of frozen and perishable food products at the Fort Worth location. The purpose of this submittal is to update the facilities Risk Management Program dated 6/06 as required by 40 CFR 68 Accidental Release Management of Highly Hazardous  Chemicals (anhydrous ammonia , 10,000lbs threshold).

The nominal refrigeration system charge is approximately 43,980 lbs of anhydrous ammonia. Ammonia is recirculated in the system as a liquid and gas depending on system operating pressures and temperatures.  The design and construction of the system is in accordance with the applicable guidelines and recommendations of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), the American National Standards Institute (ANSI), The American Society of heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE), and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

Anhydrous ammonia has been safely used in the United States and Worldwide as an efficient refrigerant for decades. Design, maintenance, repair and operation of the system are conducted in accordance with OSHA Regulation 29 CFR 1910.119 (Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals).  The system is continuously monitored and inspected by technicians  who are qualified and trained in accordance with the requirements of the facility's PSM program. These operators monitor the syst

em for any indication of leaks or equipment problems by daily visual inspections, a process control system and permanent  continuous ammonia detectors capable of distinguishing the presence of ammonia in the atmosphere at levels protective of employee health and safety. Any indication of deviation from process set points or leaks would result in the immediate isolation of the problem area from the remainder of the system and prompt repair. In the event that a leak should occur in the system in spite of precautions taken, the ammonia detectors will sound an alarm to alert the operators. The system is equipped with redundant controls to assure that the system operates safely.

The facility's PSM program includes employee information and training, process hazard analyses, management of change, pre-startup safety reviews for system changesor additions, and safe work practices. Contractors working on the system are pre-qualified based on safety performance.

Associated Wholesale Grocers Inc. is continually reviewing and updating the Fort Worth DC's PSM program. Associated has also implemented an Emergency Response Plan to be followed in the unlikely event of an accident or release. The Emergency Response Plan describes the notification protocol to be used in the event of an ammonia release. The notifications in the event of a sudden release of over 100 lbs of ammonia would include the local fire department, the Tarrant County  Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), the State Emergency Response Commission, and the National Response Center.  The Fort Worth fire Department and the Tarrant County LEPC are provided copies of the Emergency Response Plan. Facility personnel have been trained to respond to incidental releases that may occur in the system and to provide technical support to the Fort Worth Fire department in the event of an emergency release of ammonia from the system. 

The facility has made arrangements with local Fire Department to respond to emergencies in

volving ammonia. The facility conducts periodic incident  response drills.  To date the facility has never experienced an ammonia  release that has resulted in employee, contractor, or offsite injuries, or offiste evacuation and/or sheltering.  

Associated Wholesale Grocers Inc. has complied with the requiremenst of Section 302 and 303 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act (EPCRA) by notifying the State Emergency Response Commission (SERC), the Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC), and the Fire Department of the presence of ammonia at the site above threshold planning quantities (TPQ). The facility files a Tier 2 Chemical Inventory each year with SERC, LEPC and the local Fire department as required by sections 311 and 312 of EPCRA.

uidelines and recommendations of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), the American National Standards Institute (ANSI), the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE), and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).
